name: tribunal
content:

a special court or group of people who are officially chosen, especially by the government, to examine (legal) problems of a particular type: a war crimes tribunal She took her case to an immigration appeals tribunal. Compare
court noun
More examplesFewer examplesHe went to the industrial tribunal to seek redress for the way his employers had discriminated against him.She remitted the case to a new tribunal for reconsideration.His appeal will be heard by a tribunal.They set up a tribunal to deal with the petty criminals.
